OscalCatalogControlTitleFieldType.description: A name given to the control, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

OscalCatalogControlMappingAssemblyType.title: Mapping
OscalCatalogControlMappingAssemblyType.description: A mapping between the containing control and another resource.

OscalCatalogControlMappingUuidFlagType.title: Mapping Identifier
OscalCatalogControlMappingUuidFlagType.description: The unique identifier for the mapping.

OscalMappingCommonMappingResourceReferen.title: Mapped Resource Reference
OscalMappingCommonMappingResourceReferen.description: A reference to a resource that is either the source or target of a mapping.

OscalMappingCommonMappingResourceReferen.title: Resource Type
OscalMappingCommonMappingResourceReferen.description: The semantic type of the resource.

OscalMappingCommonMappingResourceReferen.title: Catalog or Profile Reference
OscalMappingCommonMappingResourceReferen.description:
A resolvable URL reference to the base catalog or profile that this profile is tailoring.

This value may be one of:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
3. a bare URI fragment (i.e., \`#uuid\`) pointing to a `back-matter` resource in this or an imported document (see [linking to another OSCAL object](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#linking-to-another-oscal-object)).

OscalMappingCommonMapAssemblyType.title: Mapping Entry
OscalMappingCommonMapAssemblyType.description: A relationship-based mapping between a source and target set consisting of members (i.e., controls, control statements) from the respective source and target.

OscalMappingCommonMapUuidFlagType.title: Mapping Entry Identifier
OscalMappingCommonMapUuidFlagType.description: The unique identifier for the mapping entry.

OscalMappingCommonMapRelationshipFieldTy.title: Mapping Entry Relationship
OscalMappingCommonMapRelationshipFieldTy.description:
The relationship type for the mapping entry, which describes the relationship between the effective requirements of the specified source and target sets.

When establishing relationships, mapping SHOULD be done at the control statement level where possible. This approach allows for more use of 'equivalent-to', which represents a stronger relationship than the other relationship types.

OscalMappingCommonMapRelationshipNsFlagT.title: Relationship Value Namespace
OscalMappingCommonMapRelationshipNsFlagT.description:
A namespace qualifying the relationship's value. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics for relationships with the same name.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

When a `ns` is not provided, its value should be assumed to be `http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal` and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.

OscalMappingCommonMappingItemAssemblyTyp.title: Mapping Entry Item (source or target)
OscalMappingCommonMappingItemAssemblyTyp.description: Identifies a specific edge within a source or target that is the subject of a mapping.

OscalMappingCommonMappingItemTypeFlagTyp.title: Subject Type
OscalMappingCommonMappingItemTypeFlagTyp.description: The semantic type of the subject.

OscalMappingCommonMappingItemIdRefFlagTy.title: Subject Identifier Reference
OscalMappingCommonMappingItemIdRefFlagTy.description: A reference to an identified subject that is of the specified `type`.

OscalCatalogGroupAssemblyType.title: Control Group
OscalCatalogGroupAssemblyType.description:
A group of controls, or of groups of controls.

Catalogs can use the catalog `group` construct to organize related controls into a single grouping, such as a family of controls or other logical organizational structure.

A `group` may have its own properties, statements, parameters, and references, which are inherited by all controls of that are a member of the group.

OscalCatalogGroupIdFlagType.title: Group Identifier
OscalCatalogGroupIdFlagType.description: Identifies the group for the purpose of cross-linking within the defining instance or from other instances that reference the catalog.

OscalCatalogGroupClassFlagType.title: Group Class
OscalCatalogGroupClassFlagType.description:
A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the group.

A `class` can be used in validation rules to express extra constraints over named items of a specific `class` value.

A `class` can also be used in an OSCAL profile as a means to target an alteration to control content.

OscalCatalogGroupTitleFieldType.title: Group Title
OscalCatalogGroupTitleFieldType.description: A name given to the group, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

OscalSspSystemSecurityPlanAssemblyType.title: System Security Plan (SSP)
OscalSspSystemSecurityPlanAssemblyType.description: A system security plan, such as those described in NIST SP 800-18.

OscalSspSystemSecurityPlanUuidFlagType.title: System Security Plan Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspSystemSecurityPlanUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this system security plan (SSP) elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `SSP` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspImportProfileAssemblyType.title: Import Profile
OscalSspImportProfileAssemblyType.description: Used to import the OSCAL profile representing the system's control baseline.

OscalSspImportProfileHrefFlagType.title: Profile Reference
OscalSspImportProfileHrefFlagType.description:
A resolvable URL reference to the profile or catalog to use as the system's control baseline.

This value may be one of:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
3. a bare URI fragment (i.e., \`#uuid\`) pointing to a `back-matter` resource in this or an imported document (see [linking to another OSCAL object](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#linking-to-another-oscal-object)).

If the resource is an OSCAL profile, it is expected that a tool will resolve the profile according to the OSCAL [profile resolution specification](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/processing/profile-resolution/) to produce a resolved profile for use when processing the containing system security plan. This allows a system security plan processor to use the baseline as a catalog of controls.

While it is possible to reference a previously resolved OSCAL profile as a catalog, this practice is discouraged since the unresolved form of the profile communicates more information about selections and changes to the underlying catalog. Furthermore, the underlying catalog can be maintained separately from the profile, which also has maintenance advantages for distinct maintainers, ensuring that the best available information is produced through profile resolution.

OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsAssemblyTyp.title: System Characteristics
OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsAssemblyTyp.description: Contains the characteristics of the system, such as its name, purpose, and security impact level.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemIdFieldTy.title: System Identification
OscalImplementationCommonSystemIdFieldTy.description: A [human-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#human-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this system identification property elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#scope). When referencing an externally defined `system identification`, the `system identification` must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference). This string should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same system across revisions of the document.

OscalImplementationCommonSystemIdIdentif.title: Identification System Type
OscalImplementationCommonSystemIdIdentif.description:
Identifies the identification system from which the provided identifier was assigned.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsSystemNameF.title: System Name - Full
OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsSystemNameF.description: The full name of the system.

OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsSystemNameS.title: System Name - Short
OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsSystemNameS.description:
A short name for the system, such as an acronym, that is suitable for display in a data table or summary list.

Since `system-name-short` is optional, if the `system-name-short` is not provided, the `system-name` can be used as a substitute.

OscalSspDateAuthorizedFieldType.title: System Authorization Date
OscalSspDateAuthorizedFieldType.description: The date the system received its authorization.

OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsSecuritySen.title: Security Sensitivity Level
OscalSspSystemCharacteristicsSecuritySen.description:
The overall information system sensitivity categorization, such as defined by [FIPS-199](https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.FIPS.199).

Often, organizations require the security sensitivity level to correspond with the highest confidentiality, integrity, or availability level identified by `security-impact-level`.

OscalSspSystemInformationAssemblyType.title: System Information
OscalSspSystemInformationAssemblyType.description: Contains details about all information types that are stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in [NIST SP 800-60](https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-60v2r1).

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: Information Type
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description: Contains details about one information type that is stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and those defined in [NIST SP 800-60](https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-60v2r1).

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: Information Type Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this information type elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `information type` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: title field
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description: A human readable name for the information type. This title should be meaningful within the context of the system.

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: Information Type Description
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description: A summary of how this information type is used within the system.

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: Information Type Categorization
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description: A set of information type identifiers qualified by the given identification `system` used, such as NIST SP 800-60.

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: Information Type Identification System
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description:
Specifies the information type identification system used.

This value must be an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that serves as a [naming system identifier](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#use-as-a-naming-system-identifier).

OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.title: Information Type Systematized Identifier
OscalSspSystemInformationInformationType.description: A [human-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#human-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier qualified by the given identification `system` used, such as NIST SP 800-60. This identifier has [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope and can be used to reference this system elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). This id should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspImpactAssemblyType.title: Impact Level
OscalSspImpactAssemblyType.description: The expected level of impact resulting from the described information.

OscalSspBaseFieldType.title: Base Level (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability)
OscalSspBaseFieldType.description: The prescribed base (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

OscalSspSelectedFieldType.title: Selected Level (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability)
OscalSspSelectedFieldType.description: The selected (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

OscalSspAdjustmentJustificationFieldType.title: Adjustment Justification
OscalSspAdjustmentJustificationFieldType.description: If the selected security level is different from the base security level, this contains the justification for the change.

OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelAssemblyType.title: Security Impact Level
OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelAssemblyType.description: The overall level of expected impact resulting from unauthorized disclosure, modification, or loss of access to information.

OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelSecurityObjec.title: Security Objective: Confidentiality
OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelSecurityObjec.description: A target-level of confidentiality for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelSecurityObjec.title: Security Objective: Integrity
OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelSecurityObjec.description: A target-level of integrity for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelSecurityObjec.title: Security Objective: Availability
OscalSspSecurityImpactLevelSecurityObjec.description: A target-level of availability for the system, based on the sensitivity of information within the system.

OscalSspStatusAssemblyType.title: Status
OscalSspStatusAssemblyType.description:
Describes the operational status of the system.

If 'other' is selected, a remark must be included to describe the current state.

OscalSspAuthorizationBoundaryAssemblyTyp.title: Authorization Boundary
OscalSspAuthorizationBoundaryAssemblyTyp.description: A description of this system's authorization boundary, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the authorization boundary.

OscalSspAuthorizationBoundaryDescription.title: Authorization Boundary Description
OscalSspAuthorizationBoundaryDescription.description: A summary of the system's authorization boundary.

OscalSspDiagramAssemblyType.title: Diagram
OscalSspDiagramAssemblyType.description:
A graphic that provides a visual representation the system, or some aspect of it.

A diagram must include a `link` with a rel value of "diagram", who's href references a remote URI or an internal reference within this document containing the diagram.

OscalSspDiagramUuidFlagType.title: Diagram ID
OscalSspDiagramUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this diagram elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `diagram` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspDiagramDescriptionFieldType.title: Diagram Description
OscalSspDiagramDescriptionFieldType.description:
A summary of the diagram.

This description is intended to be used as alternate text to support compliance with requirements from [Section 508 of the United States Workforce Rehabilitation Act of 1973](https://www.section508.gov/manage/laws-and-policies).

OscalSspDiagramCaptionFieldType.title: Caption
OscalSspDiagramCaptionFieldType.description: A brief caption to annotate the diagram.

OscalSspNetworkArchitectureAssemblyType.title: Network Architecture
OscalSspNetworkArchitectureAssemblyType.description: A description of the system's network architecture, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate the network architecture.

OscalSspNetworkArchitectureDescriptionFi.title: Network Architecture Description
OscalSspNetworkArchitectureDescriptionFi.description: A summary of the system's network architecture.

OscalSspDataFlowAssemblyType.title: Data Flow
OscalSspDataFlowAssemblyType.description: A description of the logical flow of information within the system and across its boundaries, optionally supplemented by diagrams that illustrate these flows.

OscalSspDataFlowDescriptionFieldType.title: Data Flow Description
OscalSspDataFlowDescriptionFieldType.description: A summary of the system's data flow.

OscalSspSystemImplementationAssemblyType.title: System Implementation
OscalSspSystemImplementationAssemblyType.description: Provides information as to how the system is implemented.

OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.title: Leveraged Authorization
OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.description: A description of another authorized system from which this system inherits capabilities that satisfy security requirements. Another term for this concept is a *common control provider*.

OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.title: Leveraged Authorization Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope and can be used to reference this leveraged authorization elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `leveraged authorization` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.title: title field
OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.description: A human readable name for the leveraged authorization in the context of the system.

OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.title: party-uuid field
OscalSspSystemImplementationLeveragedAut.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to the `party` that manages the leveraged system.

OscalSspControlImplementationAssemblyTyp.title: Control Implementation
OscalSspControlImplementationAssemblyTyp.description:
Describes how the system satisfies a set of controls.

Use of `set-parameter` in this context, sets the parameter for all controls referenced by any `implemented-requirement` contained in this context. Any `set-parameter` defined in a child context will override this value. If not overridden by a child, this value applies in the child context.

OscalSspControlImplementationDescription.title: Control Implementation Description
OscalSspControlImplementationDescription.description: A statement describing important things to know about how this set of control satisfaction documentation is approached.

OscalImplementationCommonSetParameterAss.title: Set Parameter Value
OscalImplementationCommonSetParameterAss.description: Identifies the parameter that will be set by the enclosed value.

OscalImplementationCommonParamIdFlagType.title: Parameter ID
OscalImplementationCommonParamIdFlagType.description: A [human-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#human-oriented) reference to a `parameter` within a control, who's catalog has been imported into the current implementation context.

OscalImplementationCommonSetParameterVal.title: Parameter Value
OscalImplementationCommonSetParameterVal.description: A parameter value or set of values.

OscalSspImplementedRequirementAssemblyTy.title: Control-based Requirement
OscalSspImplementedRequirementAssemblyTy.description:
Describes how the system satisfies the requirements of an individual control.

Use of `set-parameter` in this context, sets the parameter for the referenced control. Any `set-parameter` defined in a child context will override this value. If not overridden by a child, this value applies in the child context.

OscalSspImplementedRequirementUuidFlagTy.title: Control Requirement Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspImplementedRequirementUuidFlagTy.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this control requirement elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `control requirement` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspStatementAssemblyType.title: Specific Control Statement
OscalSspStatementAssemblyType.description: Identifies which statements within a control are addressed.

OscalImplementationCommonStatementIdFlag.title: Control Statement Reference
OscalImplementationCommonStatementIdFlag.description: A [human-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#human-oriented) identifier reference to a `control statement`.

OscalSspStatementUuidFlagType.title: Control Statement Reference Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspStatementUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this control statement elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The *UUID* of the `control statement` in the source OSCAL instance is sufficient to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).

OscalSspByComponentAssemblyType.title: Component Control Implementation
OscalSspByComponentAssemblyType.description:
Defines how the referenced component implements a set of controls.

Use of `set-parameter` in this context, sets the parameter for the control referenced in the containing `implemented-requirement` applied to the referenced component. If the `by-component` is used as a child of a `statement`, then the parameter value also applies only in the context of the referenced statement. If the same parameter is also set in the `control-implementation` or a specific `implemented-requirement`, then this `by-component/set-parameter` value will override the other value(s) in the context of the referenced component, control, and statement (if parent).

OscalSspByComponentComponentUuidFlagType.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
OscalSspByComponentComponentUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to the `component` that is implemeting a given control.

OscalSspByComponentUuidFlagType.title: By-Component Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspByComponentUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this by-component entry elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `by-component` entry can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspByComponentDescriptionFieldType.title: Control Implementation Description
OscalSspByComponentDescriptionFieldType.description: An implementation statement that describes how a control or a control statement is implemented within the referenced system component.

OscalSspByComponentExportAssemblyType.title: Export
OscalSspByComponentExportAssemblyType.description: Identifies content intended for external consumption, such as with leveraged organizations.

OscalSspByComponentExportDescriptionFiel.title: Control Implementation Export Description
OscalSspByComponentExportDescriptionFiel.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that can be available to another system leveraging this system.

OscalSspByComponentExportProvidedAssembl.title: Provided Control Implementation
OscalSspByComponentExportProvidedAssembl.description: Describes a capability which may be inherited by a leveraging system.

OscalSspByComponentExportProvidedUuidFla.title: Provided Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspByComponentExportProvidedUuidFla.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this provided entry elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `provided` entry can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspByComponentExportProvidedDescrip.title: Provided Control Implementation Description
OscalSspByComponentExportProvidedDescrip.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that can be provided to another system leveraging this system.

OscalSspByComponentExportResponsibilityA.title: Control Implementation Responsibility
OscalSspByComponentExportResponsibilityA.description: Describes a control implementation responsibility imposed on a leveraging system.

OscalSspByComponentExportResponsibilityU.title: Responsibility Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspByComponentExportResponsibilityU.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this responsibility elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `responsibility` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspProvidedUuidFlagType.title: Provided UUID
OscalSspProvidedUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to an inherited control implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.

OscalSspByComponentExportResponsibilityD.title: Control Implementation Responsibility Description
OscalSspByComponentExportResponsibilityD.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of the control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system must implement to satisfy the control provided by a leveraged system.

OscalSspByComponentInheritedAssemblyType.title: Inherited Control Implementation
OscalSspByComponentInheritedAssemblyType.description: Describes a control implementation inherited by a leveraging system.

OscalSspByComponentInheritedUuidFlagType.title: Inherited Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspByComponentInheritedUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this inherited entry elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `inherited control implementation` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspByComponentInheritedDescriptionF.title: Inherited Control Implementation Description
OscalSspByComponentInheritedDescriptionF.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is inheriting from a leveraged system.

OscalSspByComponentSatisfiedAssemblyType.title: Satisfied Control Implementation Responsibility
OscalSspByComponentSatisfiedAssemblyType.description: Describes how this system satisfies a responsibility imposed by a leveraged system.

OscalSspByComponentSatisfiedUuidFlagType.title: Satisfied Universally Unique Identifier
OscalSspByComponentSatisfiedUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this satisfied control implementation entry elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ssp-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `control implementation` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalSspResponsibilityUuidFlagType.title: Responsibility UUID
OscalSspResponsibilityUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a control implementation that satisfies a responsibility imposed by a leveraged system.

OscalSspByComponentSatisfiedDescriptionF.title: Satisfied Control Implementation Responsibility Description
OscalSspByComponentSatisfiedDescriptionF.description: An implementation statement that describes the aspects of a control or control statement implementation that a leveraging system is implementing based on a requirement from a leveraged system.

OscalPoamPlanOfActionAndMilestonesAssemb.title: Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M)
OscalPoamPlanOfActionAndMilestonesAssemb.description:
A plan of action and milestones which identifies initial and residual risks, deviations, and disposition, such as those required by FedRAMP.

Either an OSCAL-based SSP must be imported, or a unique system-id must be specified. Both may be present.

OscalPoamPlanOfActionAndMilestonesUuidFl.title: POA&M Universally Unique Identifier
OscalPoamPlanOfActionAndMilestonesUuidFl.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#instance)scope that can be used to reference this POA\&M instance in [this OSCAL instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#poam-identifiers). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalAssessmentCommonImportSspAssemblyTy.title: Import System Security Plan
OscalAssessmentCommonImportSspAssemblyTy.description: Used by the assessment plan and POA\&M to import information about the system.

OscalAssessmentCommonImportSspHrefFlagTy.title: System Security Plan Reference
OscalAssessmentCommonImportSspHrefFlagTy.description:
A resolvable URL reference to the system security plan for the system being assessed.

This value may be one of:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
3. a bare URI fragment (i.e., \`#uuid\`) pointing to a `back-matter` resource in this or an imported document (see [linking to another OSCAL object](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#linking-to-another-oscal-object)).

OscalPoamLocalDefinitionsAssemblyType.title: Local Definitions
OscalPoamLocalDefinitionsAssemblyType.description: Allows components, and inventory-items to be defined within the POA\&M for circumstances where no OSCAL-based SSP exists, or is not delivered with the POA\&M.

OscalPoamPoamItemUuidFlagType.title: POA&M Item Universally Unique Identifier
OscalPoamPoamItemUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#instance) scope that can be used to reference this POA\&M item entry in [this OSCAL instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#poam-identifiers). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalPoamPoamItemTitleFieldType.title: POA&M Item Title
OscalPoamPoamItemTitleFieldType.description: The title or name for this POA\&M item .

OscalPoamPoamItemDescriptionFieldType.title: POA&M Item Description
OscalPoamPoamItemDescriptionFieldType.description: A human-readable description of POA\&M item.

OscalPoamPoamItemOriginAssemblyType.title: Origin
OscalPoamPoamItemOriginAssemblyType.description:
Identifies the source of the finding, such as a tool or person.

Used to identify the individual and/or tool generated this poam-item.

OscalPoamPoamItemRelatedFindingAssemblyT.title: Related Finding
OscalPoamPoamItemRelatedFindingAssemblyT.description: Relates the poam-item to referenced finding(s).

OscalPoamPoamItemRelatedFindingFindingUu.title: Finding Universally Unique Identifier Reference
OscalPoamPoamItemRelatedFindingFindingUu.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a finding defined in the list of findings.

OscalPoamPoamItemRelatedObservationAssem.title: Related Observation
OscalPoamPoamItemRelatedObservationAssem.description: Relates the poam-item to a set of referenced observations that were used to determine the finding.

OscalPoamPoamItemRelatedObservationObser.title: Observation Universally Unique Identifier Reference
OscalPoamPoamItemRelatedObservationObser.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to an observation defined in the list of observations.

OscalPoamPoamItemAssociatedRiskAssemblyT.title: Associated Risk
OscalPoamPoamItemAssociatedRiskAssemblyT.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced risks that were used to determine the finding.

OscalPoamPoamItemAssociatedRiskRiskUuidF.title: Risk Universally Unique Identifier Reference
OscalPoamPoamItemAssociatedRiskRiskUuidF.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented) identifier reference to a risk defined in the list of risks.

OscalMappingMappingCollectionAssemblyTyp.title: Mapping Collection
OscalMappingMappingCollectionAssemblyTyp.description:
A collection of relationship-based control and/or control statement mappings.

A mapping collection affirmatively declares the relationships that exist between sets of controls and/or control statements in a source and target. It is expected that inferences can be made based on what is mapped; however, no inferences should be made based on what is not mapped, since it is impossible to quantify how complete or granular a given mapping is.

OscalMappingMappingCollectionUuidFlagTyp.title: Mapping Collection Universally Unique Identifier
OscalMappingMappingCollectionUuidFlagTyp.description: A globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope for this catalog instance. This UUID should be changed when this document is revised.

OscalMappingMappingAssemblyType.title: Control Mapping
OscalMappingMappingAssemblyType.description: A mapping between two target resources.

OscalMappingMappingUuidFlagType.title: Mapping Universally Unique Identifier
OscalMappingMappingUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this mapping definition elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined *UUID* of the `mapping` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same mapping across revisions of the document.

OscalComponentDefinitionComponentDefinit.title: Component Definition
OscalComponentDefinitionComponentDefinit.description: A collection of component descriptions, which may optionally be grouped by capability.

OscalComponentDefinitionComponentDefinit.title: Component Definition Universally Unique Identifier
OscalComponentDefinitionComponentDefinit.description: Provides a globally unique means to identify a given component definition instance.

OscalComponentDefinitionImportComponentD.title: Import Component Definition
OscalComponentDefinitionImportComponentD.description: Loads a component definition from another resource.

OscalComponentDefinitionImportComponentD.title: Hyperlink Reference
OscalComponentDefinitionImportComponentD.description:
A link to a resource that defines a set of components and/or capabilities to import into this collection.

This value may be one of:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
3. a bare URI fragment (i.e., \`#uuid\`) pointing to a `back-matter` resource in this or an imported document (see [linking to another OSCAL object](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#linking-to-another-oscal-object)).

OscalComponentDefinitionDefinedComponent.title: Component
OscalComponentDefinitionDefinedComponent.description:
A defined component that can be part of an implemented system.

Components may be products, services, APIs, policies, processes, plans, guidance, standards, or other tangible items that enable security and/or privacy.

The `type` indicates which of these component types is represented.

A group of components may be aggregated into a `capability`. For example, an account management capability that consists of an account management process, and a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) software implementation.

Capabilities are expressed by combining one or more components.

OscalComponentDefinitionDefinedComponent.title: Component Identifier
OscalComponentDefinitionDefinedComponent.description: Provides a globally unique means to identify a given component.

OscalComponentDefinitionDefinedComponent.title: Component Type
OscalComponentDefinitionDefinedComponent.description: A category describing the purpose of the component.

OscalComponentDefinitionDefinedComponent.title: Component Title
OscalComponentDefinitionDefinedComponent.description: A human readable name for the component.

OscalComponentDefinitionDefinedComponent.title: Component Description
OscalComponentDefinitionDefinedComponent.description: A description of the component, including information about its function.

OscalComponentDefinitionDefinedComponent.title: Purpose
OscalComponentDefinitionDefinedComponent.description: A summary of the technological or business purpose of the component.

OscalComponentDefinitionControlImplement.title: Control Implementation Set
OscalComponentDefinitionControlImplement.description:
Defines how the component or capability supports a set of controls.

Use of `set-parameter` in this context, sets the parameter for all controls referenced by any `implemented-requirement` contained in this context. Any `set-parameter` defined in a child context will override this value. If not overridden by a child, this value applies in the child context.

OscalComponentDefinitionControlImplement.title: Control Implementation Set Identifier
OscalComponentDefinitionControlImplement.description: Provides a means to identify a set of control implementations that are supported by a given component or capability.

OscalComponentDefinitionControlImplement.title: Source Resource Reference
OscalComponentDefinitionControlImplement.description:
A reference to an OSCAL catalog or profile providing the referenced control or subcontrol definition.

This value may be one of:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
3. a bare URI fragment (i.e., \`#uuid\`) pointing to a `back-matter` resource in this or an imported document (see [linking to another OSCAL object](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#linking-to-another-oscal-object)).

OscalComponentDefinitionControlImplement.title: Control Implementation Description
OscalComponentDefinitionControlImplement.description: A description of how the specified set of controls are implemented for the containing component or capability.

OscalComponentDefinitionImplementedRequi.title: Control Implementation
OscalComponentDefinitionImplementedRequi.description:
Describes how the containing component or capability implements an individual control.

Implemented requirements within a component or capability in a component definition provide a means for component suppliers to suggest possible control implementation details, which may be used by a different party (e.g., component consumers) when authoring a system security plan. Thus, these requirements defined in a component definition are only a suggestion of how to implement, which may be adopted wholesale, changed, or ignored by a person defining an information system implementation.

Use of `set-parameter` in this context, sets the parameter for the referenced control and any associated statements.

OscalComponentDefinitionImplementedRequi.title: Control Implementation Identifier
OscalComponentDefinitionImplementedRequi.description: Provides a globally unique means to identify a given control implementation by a component.

OscalComponentDefinitionImplementedRequi.title: Control Implementation Description
OscalComponentDefinitionImplementedRequi.description: A suggestion from the supplier (e.g., component vendor or author) for how the specified control may be implemented if the containing component or capability is instantiated in a system security plan.

OscalComponentDefinitionStatementAssembl.title: Control Statement Implementation
OscalComponentDefinitionStatementAssembl.description: Identifies which statements within a control are addressed.

OscalComponentDefinitionStatementUuidFla.title: Control Statement Reference Universally Unique Identifier
OscalComponentDefinitionStatementUuidFla.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this control statement elsewhere in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#component-definition-identifiers). The *UUID* of the `control statement` in the source OSCAL instance is sufficient to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).

OscalComponentDefinitionStatementDescrip.title: Statement Implementation Description
OscalComponentDefinitionStatementDescrip.description: A summary of how the containing control statement is implemented by the component or capability.

OscalComponentDefinitionCapabilityAssemb.title: Capability
OscalComponentDefinitionCapabilityAssemb.description: A grouping of other components and/or capabilities.

OscalComponentDefinitionCapabilityUuidFl.title: Capability Identifier
OscalComponentDefinitionCapabilityUuidFl.description: Provides a globally unique means to identify a given capability.

OscalComponentDefinitionIncorporatesComp.title: Incorporates Component
OscalComponentDefinitionIncorporatesComp.description: The collection of components comprising this capability.

OscalComponentDefinitionIncorporatesComp.title: Component Description
OscalComponentDefinitionIncorporatesComp.description: A description of the component, including information about its function.

OscalProfileProfileAssemblyType.title: Profile
OscalProfileProfileAssemblyType.description:
Each OSCAL profile is defined by a `profile` element.

An OSCAL document that describes a tailoring of controls from one or more catalogs, with possible modification of multiple controls. It provides mechanisms by which controls may be selected (`import`), merged or (re)structured (`merge`), and amended (`modify`). OSCAL profiles may select subsets of controls, set parameter values for them in application, and even adjust the representation of controls as given in and by a catalog. They may also serve as sources for further modification in and by other profiles, that import them.

OscalProfileProfileUuidFlagType.title: Profile Universally Unique Identifier
OscalProfileProfileUuidFlagType.description: Provides a globally unique means to identify a given profile instance.

OscalProfileImportAssemblyType.title: Import Resource
OscalProfileImportAssemblyType.description:
Designates a referenced source catalog or profile that provides a source of control information for use in creating a new overlay or baseline.

The contents of the `import` element indicate which controls from the source will be included. Controls from the source catalog or profile may be either selected, using the `include-all` or `include-controls` directives, or de-selected (using an `exclude-controls` directive).

OscalProfileImportHrefFlagType.title: Catalog or Profile Reference
OscalProfileImportHrefFlagType.description:
A resolvable URL reference to the base catalog or profile that this profile is tailoring.

This value may be one of:

1. an [absolute URI](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#absolute-uri) that points to a network resolvable resource,
2. a [relative reference](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#relative-reference) pointing to a network resolvable resource whose base URI is the URI of the containing document, or
3. a bare URI fragment (i.e., \`#uuid\`) pointing to a `back-matter` resource in this or an imported document (see [linking to another OSCAL object](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/uri-use/#linking-to-another-oscal-object)).

OscalProfileSelectControlByIdAssemblyTyp.title: Select Control
OscalProfileSelectControlByIdAssemblyTyp.description:
Select a control or controls from an imported control set.

If `with-child-controls` is "yes" on the call to a control, no sibling `call`elements need to be used to call any controls appearing within it. Since generally, this is how control enhancements are represented (as controls within controls), this provides a way to include controls with all their dependent controls (enhancements) without having to call them individually.

OscalProfileWithChildControlsFlagType.title: Include Contained Controls with Control
OscalProfileWithChildControlsFlagType.description: When a control is included, whether its child (dependent) controls are also included.

OscalProfileSelectControlByIdWithIdField.title: Match Controls by Identifier
OscalProfileSelectControlByIdWithIdField.description: Selecting a control by its ID given as a literal.

OscalProfileSelectControlByIdMatchingAss.title: Match Controls by Pattern
OscalProfileSelectControlByIdMatchingAss.description: Selecting a set of controls by matching their IDs with a wildcard pattern.

OscalProfilePatternFlagType.title: Pattern
OscalProfilePatternFlagType.description: A [glob expression](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glob_(programming)) matching the IDs of one or more controls to be selected.

OscalProfileMergeAssemblyType.title: Merge Controls
OscalProfileMergeAssemblyType.description: Provides structuring directives that instruct how controls are organized after profile resolution.

OscalProfileMergeCombineAssemblyType.title: Combination Rule
OscalProfileMergeCombineAssemblyType.description: A Combine element defines how to resolve duplicate instances of the same control (e.g., controls with the same ID).

OscalProfileMergeCombineMethodFlagType.title: Combination Method
OscalProfileMergeCombineMethodFlagType.description: Declare how clashing controls should be handled.

OscalProfileMergeFlatAssemblyType.title: Flat Without Grouping
OscalProfileMergeFlatAssemblyType.description: Directs that controls appear without any grouping structure.

OscalProfileMergeAsIsFieldType.title: Group As-Is
OscalProfileMergeAsIsFieldType.description: Indicates that the controls selected should retain their original grouping as defined in the import source.

OscalProfileMergeCustomAssemblyType.title: Custom Grouping
OscalProfileMergeCustomAssemblyType.description:
Provides an alternate grouping structure that selected controls will be placed in.

The `custom` element represents a custom arrangement or organization of controls in the resolution of a catalog. This structuring directive gives the profile author the ability to define an entirely different organization of controls as compared to their source catalog(s).

OscalProfileGroupAssemblyType.title: Control Group
OscalProfileGroupAssemblyType.description:
A group of (selected) controls or of groups of controls.

This construct mirrors the same construct that exists in an OSCAL catalog.

OscalProfileGroupIdFlagType.title: Group Identifier
OscalProfileGroupIdFlagType.description:
Identifies the group.

This optional data element is available to support hyperlinking to formal groups or families as defined in control catalogs, among other operations.

OscalProfileGroupClassFlagType.title: Group Class
OscalProfileGroupClassFlagType.description:
A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the group.

A `class` can be used in validation rules to express extra constraints over named items of a specific `class` value.

A `class` can also be used in an OSCAL profile as a means to target an alteration to control content.

OscalProfileGroupTitleFieldType.title: Group Title
OscalProfileGroupTitleFieldType.description: A name to be given to the group for use in display.

OscalProfileInsertControlsAssemblyType.title: Select Controls
OscalProfileInsertControlsAssemblyType.description:
Specifies which controls to use in the containing context.

To be schema-valid, this element must contain either (but not both) a single `include-all` directive, or a sequence of `include-controls` directives.

If this directive is not provided, then no controls are to be inserted; i.e., all controls are included explicitly.

OscalProfileInsertControlsOrderFlagType.title: Order
OscalProfileInsertControlsOrderFlagType.description: A designation of how a selection of controls in a profile is to be ordered.

OscalProfileModifyAssemblyType.title: Modify Controls
OscalProfileModifyAssemblyType.description: Set parameters or amend controls in resolution.

OscalProfileModifySetParameterAssemblyTy.title: Parameter Setting
OscalProfileModifySetParameterAssemblyTy.description: A parameter setting, to be propagated to points of insertion.

OscalProfileModifySetParameterClassFlagT.title: Parameter Class
OscalProfileModifySetParameterClassFlagT.description:
A textual label that provides a characterization of the parameter.

A `class` can be used in validation rules to express extra constraints over named items of a specific `class` value.

OscalProfileModifySetParameterDependsOnF.title: Depends On
OscalProfileModifySetParameterDependsOnF.description: \*\*(deprecated)\*\* Another parameter invoking this one. This construct has been deprecated and should not be used.

OscalProfileModifySetParameterLabelField.title: Parameter Label
OscalProfileModifySetParameterLabelField.description:
A short, placeholder name for the parameter, which can be used as a substitute for a `value` if no value is assigned.

The label value should be suitable for inline display in a rendered catalog.

OscalProfileModifySetParameterUsageField.title: Parameter Usage Description
OscalProfileModifySetParameterUsageField.description: Describes the purpose and use of a parameter.

OscalProfileModifyAlterAssemblyType.title: Alteration
OscalProfileModifyAlterAssemblyType.description:
Specifies changes to be made to an included control when a profile is resolved.

Use `@control-id` to indicate the scope of alteration.

It is an error for two `alter` elements to apply to the same control. In practice, multiple alterations can be applied (together), but it creates confusion.

At present, no provision is made for altering many controls at once (for example, to systematically remove properties or add global properties); extending this element to match multiple control IDs could provide for this.

OscalProfileModifyAlterRemoveAssemblyTyp.title: Removal
OscalProfileModifyAlterRemoveAssemblyTyp.description:
Specifies objects to be removed from a control based on specific aspects of the object that must all match.

Use `by-name`, `by-class`, `by-id` or `by-item-name` to indicate class tokens or ID reference, or the formal name, of the component to be removed or erased from a control, when a catalog is resolved. The control affected is indicated by the pointer on the removal's parent (containing) `alter` element.

To change an element, use `remove` to remove the element, then `add` to add it back again with changes.

OscalProfileModifyAlterRemoveByNameFlagT.title: Reference by (assigned) name
OscalProfileModifyAlterRemoveByNameFlagT.description: Identify items remove by matching their assigned name.

OscalProfileModifyAlterRemoveByClassFlag.title: Reference by class
OscalProfileModifyAlterRemoveByClassFlag.description: Identify items to remove by matching their `class`.

OscalProfileModifyAlterRemoveByIdFlagTyp.title: Reference by ID
OscalProfileModifyAlterRemoveByIdFlagTyp.description: Identify items to remove indicated by their `id`.

OscalProfileModifyAlterRemoveByItemNameF.title: Item Name Reference
OscalProfileModifyAlterRemoveByItemNameF.description: Identify items to remove by the name of the item's information object name, e.g. `title` or `prop`.

OscalProfileModifyAlterRemoveByNsFlagTyp.title: Item Namespace Reference
OscalProfileModifyAlterRemoveByNsFlagTyp.description: Identify items to remove by the item's `ns`, which is the namespace associated with a `part`, or `prop`.

OscalProfileModifyAlterAddAssemblyType.title: Addition
OscalProfileModifyAlterAddAssemblyType.description:
Specifies contents to be added into controls, in resolution.

When no `by-id` is given, the addition is inserted into the control targeted by the alteration at the start or end as indicated by `position`. Only `position` values of "starting" or "ending" are permitted when there is no `by-id`.

`by-id`, when given, should indicate, by its ID, an element inside the control to serve as the anchor point for the addition. In this case, `position` value may be any of the permitted values.

OscalProfileModifyAlterAddPositionFlagTy.title: Position
OscalProfileModifyAlterAddPositionFlagTy.description: Where to add the new content with respect to the targeted element (beside it or inside it).

OscalProfileModifyAlterAddTitleFieldType.title: Title Change
OscalProfileModifyAlterAddTitleFieldType.description: A name given to the control, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

OscalApAssessmentPlanAssemblyType.title: Security Assessment Plan (SAP)
OscalApAssessmentPlanAssemblyType.description: An assessment plan, such as those provided by a FedRAMP assessor.

OscalApAssessmentPlanUuidFlagType.title: Assessment Plan Universally Unique Identifier
OscalApAssessmentPlanUuidFlagType.description: A [machine-oriented](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#machine-oriented), [globally unique](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#globally-unique) identifier with [cross-instance](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#cross-instance) scope that can be used to reference this assessment plan in [this or other OSCAL instances](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#ap-identifiers). The locally defined *UUID* of the `assessment plan` can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned [per-subject](https://pages.nist.gov/OSCAL/concepts/identifier-use/#consistency), which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

OscalApAssessmentPlanLocalDefinitionsAss.title: Local Definitions
OscalApAssessmentPlanLocalDefinitionsAss.description: Used to define data objects that are used in the assessment plan, that do not appear in the referenced SSP.

OscalApAssessmentPlanTermsAndConditionsA.title: Assessment Plan Terms and Conditions
OscalApAssessmentPlanTermsAndConditionsA.description: Used to define various terms and conditions under which an assessment, described by the plan, can be performed. Each child part defines a different type of term or condition.

UUIDDatatype.description: A type 4 ('random' or 'pseudorandom') or type 5 UUID per RFC 4122.
